{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question is asking about the type of malignancy that is least commonly associated with lymphatic spread. Looking through the documents, there is no direct information about the lymphatic spread of the specific malignancies listed in the options. However, it is generally known in the medical field that Basal Cell Carcinoma (BCC) rarely metastasizes or spreads to lymph nodes or distant parts of the body. This is because BCC typically grows slowly and is confined to the epidermis. On the other hand, Squamous Cell Carcinoma, Malignant Melanoma, and Merkel Cell Carcinoma are known to have a higher potential for lymphatic spread and metastasis.", "answer_choice": "A"}
